definition: to clutch/to grab/to capture
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample
to catch/to seize/to capture
lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
to tease
to arrest/to catch a criminal
to play hide-and-seek
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to bring to justice
to catch a couple in the act (adultery, illicit sexual relations)
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others

it doesn't matter whether a cat is white or black; as long as it catches mice it's a good cat (variant of a Sichuanese saying used in a speech by Deng Xiaoping 鄧小平|邓小平[Deng4 Xiao3 ping2] in 1962, usually associated with his economic reforms starting in 1978, in which pragmatism was favored over ideological purity)
pinyin: bu4 guan3 bai2 mao1 hei1 mao1 , zhuo1 zhu4 lao3 shu3 jiu4 shi4 hao3 mao1
containing_words.word: 不管白貓黑貓，捉住老鼠就是好貓

definition: to capture
humorous pronunciation of 著急|着急[zhao2 ji2]

sentences.english: All summer, my goal HAS BEEN to catch a firefly. ---How do you translate HAS BEEN?
sentences.chinese: 整個夏天，我的目的就是捉到一隻熒火蟲。

sentences.english: The mother bear will see you across the lake and she'll want to hunt you.
sentences.chinese: 看到你，那頭母熊肯定要捉你。

sentences.english: Yesterday my brother and I went to catch crabs again.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我又和哥哥一起去捉螃蟹了。

sentences.english: Whales use their pectinate teeth to gather plankton.
sentences.chinese: 鯨魚用牠們櫛齒狀的牙齒來捉浮游生物。

sentences.english: Para-Medic: I see you've caught yourself a maroon shark.
sentences.chinese: 我看到你捉了一條慄鯊。

sentences.english: She lives upstairs, over there, next door to Joe the baby-grabber.
sentences.chinese: 她住在樓上，那邊，那個“捉小孩的人”喬的隔壁。

sentences.english: The fleets then squared off against one another in the course of a weekend.
sentences.chinese: 一星期結束，所有艦隊將擺開陣型，捉對交戰。

sentences.english: He reached for it with both hands and stirred up the milky mud at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 他用雙手去捉，把水底的乳白色泥漿全攪渾了。

sentences.english: It was fun, but Ellen didn's catch any fish.
sentences.chinese: 那很有趣，但是艾倫一條魚都沒捉到。

sentences.english: Altogether we caught ten golden monkeys.
sentences.chinese: 我們一共捉到十隻金絲猴。

sentences.english: I wanted to ask, How could you think you wouldn’t get caught?
sentences.chinese: 我想問她，你怎麼敢認爲自己不會被捉到？

sentences.english: The fish we caught is still alive .
Para-Medic: I see you've captured a poison dart frog.
sentences.chinese: 我看見你捉到一隻毒箭蛙。

sentences.english: One box tropical fish is raised in the Internet bar, raise a flower that can catch mouse to spend a cat even.
sentences.chinese: 網吧裏養一箱熱帶魚，甚至養一條能捉老鼠的花花貓。

sentences.english: Or, maybe, you just watch Ghost Hunters.
sentences.chinese: 或者，你剛剛看了《捉鬼敢死隊》。
